FUNCTION_TITLE

Source: R/x_join_on.R
join_on_concept_synonym_name.Rd

FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION

join_on_concept_synonym_name(
  kind = c("LEFT", "RIGHT", "INNER", "FULL"),
  data,
  column = NULL,
  select_data_columns = "*",
  distinct = FALSE,
  write_schema = "patelm9",
  vocab_schema = "omop_vocabulary",
  where_in_concept_synonym_field,
  where_in_concept_synonym_field_value,
  where_not_in_concept_synonym_field,
  where_not_in_concept_synonym_field_value,
  where_is_null_concept_synonym_field,
  where_is_not_null_concept_synonym_field,
  case_insensitive = TRUE,
  conn,
  conn_fun = "connectAthena()",
  verbose = TRUE,
  render_sql = TRUE,
  render_only = FALSE
)

Arguments

kind

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: c("LEFT", "RIGHT", "INNER", "FULL")
data

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
column

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: NULL
select_data_columns

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: '*'
distinct

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: FALSE
write_schema

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'patelm9'
vocab_schema

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'omop_vocabulary'
where_in_concept_synonym_field

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
where_in_concept_synonym_field_value

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
where_not_in_concept_synonym_field

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
where_not_in_concept_synonym_field_value

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
where_is_null_concept_synonym_field

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
where_is_not_null_concept_synonym_field

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
conn

PARAM_DESCRIPTION
conn_fun

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: 'connectAthena()'
verbose

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: TRUE
render_sql

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: TRUE
render_only

PARAM_DESCRIPTION, Default: FALSE

Examples

library(chariot)
library(tidyverse)


test_data <-
        queryAthena(sql_statement =     "
                                        SELECT
                                                concept_id AS test_concept_id,
                                                concept_name AS test_concept_name,
                                                concept_code AS test_concept_code
                                        FROM omop_vocabulary.concept
                                        ORDER BY RANDOM()
                                        LIMIT 20;")

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Loading Cache...
#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Cached SQL: 
#>                                         SELECT
#>                                                 concept_id AS test_concept_id,
#>                                                 concept_name AS test_concept_name,
#>                                                 concept_code AS test_concept_code
#>                                         FROM omop_vocabulary.concept
#>                                         ORDER BY RANDOM()
#>                                         LIMIT 20;
#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Cached resultset found...
test_data

#> # A tibble: 20 x 3

# `Join On` functions point to the true column that is being joined on
join_on_concept_id(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_id"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

join_on_concept_code(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_code"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_code
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

join_on_concept_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# Join on the `concept_synonym_name` field in the Concept Synonym table
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# Reconfigure the kind of join
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        kind = "INNER"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# Return only distinct rows
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        kind = "INNER",
        distinct = TRUE
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# Return only the `test_concept_code` column
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        kind = "INNER",
        distinct = TRUE,
        select_data_columns = "test_concept_name"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already


# Filter can be applied to the vocabulary tables
join_on_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        column = "test_concept_name",
        where_not_in_concept_synonym_field = "language_concept_id",
        where_not_in_concept_synonym_field_value = 4180186
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_name
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# `Join For` functions join on a predetermined vocabulary field for the addition
# of the specified column in the source data

# Get all the synonyms for a concept by concept_id
join_for_concept_synonym_name(
        data = test_data,
        concept_id_column = "test_concept_id"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already


# Get the descendant concept ids
join_for_descendant_ids(
        data = test_data,
        ancestor_id_column = "test_concept_id"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# Get the ancestor concept ids
join_for_ancestor_ids(
        data = test_data,
        descendant_id_column = "test_concept_id"
        )

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

# To retrieve all the attributes for either the ancestor or descendants, use
# the following functions
join_for_descendants(
        data = test_data,
        ancestor_id_column = "test_concept_id"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already

join_for_ancestors(
        data = test_data,
        descendant_id_column = "test_concept_id"
)

#> [2021-01-01 16:14:17]	Target column: test_concept_id
#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(jdbcDriver, "Ljava/sql/Connection;", "connect",     as.character(url), p): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: FATAL: sorry, too many clients already
